DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Document Amendment Review Response Signature Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date the amendment review response was sent out for signature.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Document Amendment Review Response Signature
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to a writing that contains information about a type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people where a change was made and evaluated and a response was sent to the individual who signs documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :A writing that contains information.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.

Property.preferredDefinition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.:The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis.:Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.:Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; an identifying feature or characteristic of something or someone; an alternative term for motif or pattern; the part of the prescription that contains directions to the patient for taking of medicine.

Concepts.definition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.
The act of appraisal, evaluation, or analysis.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; having a handwritten signature.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
